page.title: 18CHRISTIE MILLER MELKSHAM
page.content: The Christie Miller Sports Centre is situated at Bowerhill. It opened to the public on 6th January 1970. The building was already on the site, but it cost Â£36,000 to buy, and the alterations came to about Â£190,000. Major S.C.Miller, whom the centre is named after, was the chairman of the council between 1963 and 1975. The centre has a large sports hall, and facilities for squash, archery, rugby, football, indoor bowling, athletics, golf, hockey and badminton. They have over 2000 members aged between 4 and 89. Members include the fastest man over hurdles and a badminton champion, and many other title holders. The centre has 38 staff; part time, full time and casual. It is open all year round from 9am to 11pm. It is only closed for 3 days over Christmas.
